What changes can be expected from the Verus Mainnet Protocol upgrade, and how do these changes impact the functionality of VerusIDs, staking, and sending currency?

The Verus Mainnet Protocol upgrade brings several significant changes to the Verus ecosystem. These changes are designed to enhance the functionality and security of VerusIDs, staking, and sending currency.

One major change is the addition of support for season 4 Komodo notary node operators, which strengthens the security of the network. Coinbase shielding will no longer be required for unshielded coinbases from the past, making it easier to manage coinbases.

Another important change is that staking will now work on all normal ID balances, enabling full use of IDs for storing and staking funds. This means that users can now use their VerusIDs to store and stake their funds, providing more flexibility and control over their assets.

The `sendcurrency` API has also been updated to provide more control when sending from and to multiple addresses or identities. This makes it easier to manage and transfer funds between different addresses and identities.

Furthermore, the `updateidentity` command has been updated to allow changing the case of characters in the name of a VerusID in the global locale. This provides more flexibility when managing VerusIDs.

In terms of revocation, the revocation identity will now lose all control over an ID after revocation, including the ability to still change the revocation identity itself. This change improves the security and control of revoked IDs, as the recovery identity will now have full control over the revoked ID.

Finally, the staking and hashing consensus protocol has been updated to VerusHash 2.2, which provides improved security and efficiency for the network.

Overall, these changes enhance the functionality and security of VerusIDs, staking, and sending currency, providing a more robust and flexible ecosystem for users.

**MAKE SURE TO UPGRADE BY June 14TH, OR YOU MAY NEED TO RESYNCHRONIZE THE BLOCKCHAIN IF YOU ARE RUNNING IN NATIVE MODE.**At block 1053660, the Verus Mainnet Protocol will upgrade to the new Komodo Notary Nodes for Komodo dPoW notarization, season 4, and a number of new capabilities, as well as a change to the Verus Proof of Power staking and mining hash will go live on the Verus mainnet as well.## The network upgrade will activate the following features:
- Added support for season 4 Komodo notary node operators- Coinbase shielding will no longer be required on any coinbases from the past that have not yet been shielded.- Staking will now work on all normal ID balances, enabling full use of IDs for storing and staking funds.- A new `sendcurrency` API for the command line provides more control when sending from and to multiple addresses or identities.- `updateidentity` will now be able to change the case of characters in the name of a VerusID in the global locale.- Revocation identity will now lose all control over an ID after revocation, including the ability to still change the revocation identity itself, which it used to retain. After revocation now, the recovery identity will have full control over the revoked ID.- Staking and hashing consensus protocol updates with VerusHash 2.2## Notable Changes:
- Fix Komodo S4 notary count
- `sendcurrency` does not require coinbase funds to be shielded.# Disclaimer
